H0.text: Consisting of billions of galaxies is how a scientific article about the universe will most likely describe the universe.

H1.text: Being less than two billion years old is how a scientific article about the universe will most likely describe the universe.

H2.text: Containing approximately ten planets is what a scientific article about the universe will most likely describe the universe as.

H3.text: Becoming smaller over time is how a scientific article about the universe will most likely describe the universe.

A6.text: A 2016 study published in The Astrophysical Journal, led by Christopher Conselice of the University of Nottingham, analyzed many sources of data to estimate that the observable universe (up to z=8) contained at least two trillion (2Ã—1012) galaxies

A7.text: Improved technology in detecting the spectra invisible to humans (radio telescopes, infrared cameras, and x-ray telescopes) allows detection of other galaxies that are not detected by Hubble
